qas.question: Whitehead observes that life is deficient in what?
What are higher life forms actively engaged in?
How many goals of living is there?
Whitehead sees life as directed towards what purpose?
Without Whitehead's proposed purpose, life would be what?
What observation did Whitehead make about life?

answers.text: "life is comparatively deficient in survival value."

qas.question: What was Whitehead's response to questions about why complex life evolved?

answers.text: "they certainly did not appear because they were better at that game than the rocks around them."

qas.question: What did Whitehead state was the biggest indicator of a higher form of life?

answers.text: they are actively engaged in modifying their environment

qas.question: What did Whitehead believe are the goals f life?

answers.text: living, living well, and living better

qas.question: What did Whitehead believe was the fundamental purpose of life?

plausible_answers.text: living, living well, and living better

qas.question: What did Whitehead believe are not the goals of life?
Whitehead observes that life is never deficient in what?
What are higher life forms never actively engaged in?
Whitehead sees life as directed away from what purpose?

context: Whitehead makes the startling observation that <a5_0>"life is comparatively deficient in <a0_0><b11_0>survival value<b11_0/><a0_0/>."<a5_0/> If humans can only exist for about a hundred years, and rocks for eight hundred million, then one is forced to ask why complex organisms ever evolved in the first place; as Whitehead humorously notes, <a6_0>"they certainly did not appear because they were better at that game than the rocks around them."<a6_0/> He then observes that the mark of higher forms of life is that <a7_0>they are actively engaged in <a1_0><b12_0>modifying their environment<b12_0/><a7_0/><a1_0/>, an activity which he theorizes is directed toward the <a2_0>three<a2_0/>-fold goal of <a8_0><b10_0>living, living well, and living better<b10_0/><a8_0/>. In other words, Whitehead sees life as directed toward the purpose of <a3_0><a9_0>increasing its own satisfaction<a9_0/><a3_0/>. Without such a goal, he sees the rise of life as totally <a4_0><b13_0>unintelligible<b13_0/><a4_0/>.
